{{cpp/chrono/duration/title|operator+{{dsc small|(unary)}}|operator-{{dsc small|(unary)}}}}
{{cpp/chrono/duration/navbar}}
{{dcl begin}}
{{dcl rev multi|num=1|until1=c++17|dcl1=
constexpr duration operator+() const;
|dcl2=
constexpr std::common_type_t&lt;duration&gt; operator+() const;
}}
{{dcl rev multi|num=2|until1=c++17|dcl1=
constexpr duration operator-() const;
|dcl2=
constexpr std::common_type_t&lt;duration&gt; operator-() const;
}}
{{dcl end}}

Implements unary plus and unary minus for the durations.

If {{tt|rep_}} is a member variable holding the number of ticks in a duration object, and {{tt|D}} is the return type,
@1@ Equivalent to {{c|return D(*this);}}.
@2@ Equivalent to {{c|return D(-rep_);}}.

===Parameters===
(none)

===Return value===
@1@ A copy of this duration object.
@2@ A copy of this duration object, with the number of ticks negated.

===Example===
{{example 
|code=
#include &lt;chrono&gt;
#include &lt;iostream&gt;
 
int main()
{
    constexpr std::chrono::seconds s1(-052);
    constexpr std::chrono::seconds s2 = -s1;
 
    std::cout &lt;&lt; "Negated " &lt;&lt; s1 &lt;&lt; " are " &lt;&lt; s2 &lt;&lt; '\n';
}
|output=
Negated -42s are 42s
}}
